page.title: 08Tourism
page.content: Bagnall and its surrounding area is very popular with tourists and particularly with the local town people who use the area as a "break" from the hustle of town life. The main attractions to the village are the old styled village and its stone houses and the local country public house-"Stafford Arms" which during the summer months attracts large numbers of people particularly evenings and weekends which themselves create a problem for local residents with their parking. Another attraction is the annual fete which is held during August. The main attraction seems to be that its close proximity to the industrial towns of North Staffordshire provides a welcome change with little travelling.
